New Records: Matt Wallner hit his 13th home run of the season
Key Match Events: Zebby Matthews was hurt by the long ball twice, allowing two Angels to hit home runs in the first two innings
Willi Castro broke his personal 0-15 streak with a game-tying knock in the bottom of the fourth
Brooks Lee followed Castro by breaking his own 0-19 streak with a double to left, plating Larnach and Castro and putting the Twins ahead 4-2
Griffin Jax came in a bit too hyped and walked Zach Neto on four pitches in the seventh inning
Christian Vázquez and a pitch-hitting Kyle Farmer gave the Twins an opportunity to extend the lead and to take some anxiety out of the closing frames with a single and double
Royce Lewis drove a ball off the top of the wall in left field, initially called a grand slam, but upon further review, it was a two-run double
Jhoan Durán took out pinch-hitter Michael Stefanic with a dynamic curveball in the ninth inning
Pre-Game Insights: Rocco Baldelli approached this game before the off day almost like a playoff game, with a sense of urgency and strategy
The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
The coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game featured a flyover by military aircraft to honor those who died on 9/11, with Jax's brother and sister-in-law serving as two of the four pilots
The Twins honored those who died on 9/11 with a moment of silence and a flag ceremony
The Twins will send out RHP Bailey Ober (12-6, 3.77 ERA) in hopes that he can repeat his outing against the Royals last week
Others: Zebby Matthews' struggles with his fastball and splitter, particularly against left-handed hitters
Jhoan Durán's recent struggles with giving up hits and runs, particularly against left-handed hitters
The Twins' need to play playoff-type baseball with winning streaks down the stretch
